intro.title: Calculate Your Net Bonus After Taxes
intro.description: Bonuses are taxed differently than regular salary. Our calculator shows exactly how much you'll keep after federal, state, and FICA taxes.

faqs.question: Are bonuses taxed differently than salary?
faqs.answer: Yes, bonuses are subject to additional FICA taxes that don't apply to regular wages. They may also be taxed at higher supplemental rates.

faqs.question: What taxes apply to bonuses?
faqs.answer: Bonuses are taxed with federal income tax, state income tax, and the full FICA tax rate (7.65%), unlike regular salary.

faqs.question: Can I defer bonus taxes?
faqs.answer: Some employers offer bonus deferral plans that allow you to postpone taxation. You may also be able to defer taxes through retirement contributions.

faqs.question: How do I maximize my bonus take-home pay?
faqs.answer: Consider timing bonuses strategically, use tax-advantaged accounts, and plan your overall tax bracket for the year.
